txt.en: 'We have begun evacuations through the caverns to the north and out the East Gate.'
'Nafni, give no voice to such things! We must try!'
'It comes!'
'The horde approaches! Ready your axes!'
'This fiend will know the might of Durin's Folk!'
'Perhaps one day we will muster a force strong enough to oust Durin's Bane... but not today.'
'Perhaps we could return to Gundabad?'
'Nary a flinch!'
King Náin I has ordered a final stand against the Balrog Durin's Bane.\n\nYou must attempt to defeat the ancient fiend, and if that fails, survive!
'Face me, vile one, and answer for my father!'
'Commander, did we rescue the survivors from the lower halls?'
'The unearthed terror will surely follow.'
'They say it can change form! That it bends flame and shadow to its will!'
'Lower not your guard! Those were just beasts, and the real threat approaches!'
'On that day I swore to avenge him, though I die in the effort!'
'Anyone who did not make it in time... is lost. Much of the kingdom has already fallen.'
'We must first find a new home. Dwarves thrive not as wanderers.'
'The time has come. If I fall here, take the ring of our clan and guide our people to safety.'
'He is still a boy....'
'We have no more time. Go, cross the bridge and live! I will hold him off!'
'How can one so young lead us in such a time?'
'We are quickly running out of ground!'
'If only Náin had not thrown his life away....'
'No! We stand no chance against it! We are mere gnats to that monster!'
'This is no easy decision, but our great kingdom must be abandoned. We cannot stand against that monster.'
'I am with you, Commander, but can such evil truly be slain? I have seen that terror with my own eyes!'
'The evacuation is complete. Where is Commander Formáth?'
'I am with you, my King.'
'Khazâd ai-mênu!'
'Retreat! He will slaughter us!'
'Yes, you are right, Nafni. Hmm....'
'Aye, Commander....'
'Aye, we must. For Khazad-dûm.'
'Father... he is gone....'
'We are not here to fight this storm-reek!'
'Enough of this! Where is Durin’s Bane?'
'Aye, as am I! Let us work together to find a new future for the Longbeards.'
'I will see it done, Prince... no, King Thráin.'
'The other routes into the Second Hall have all been closed.'
'If we cannot get everyone out, this will be the end of the Longbeards!'
'It has been one year since my father was slain by the fiend we now call 'Durin's Bane!''
'King Náin has sworn vengeance for his father, and will not falter!'
'We dwarves are all who remain of proud Khazad-dûm.'
TBD
'We have no choice, Thráin! It would shame our folk to let the kingdom fall without a fight!'
Survive the wrath of Durin's Bane
'The path is not well-travelled, but we must keep our people from harm when the fighting begins.'
'Is that...? Can it be?'
'There they will meet our axes.'
The Fall of Khazad-dûm -- Tier 1
'Prince Thráin! Listen to me! You must lead our people now! Sound the retreat!'
'May the First Crafter grant me the strength and wisdom to be the leader you need and deserve!'
'What hope have we of defeating one of Morgoth's own minions?'
'This will be our final stand, Nafni. Focus on the battle to come, or else every life lost will be for nothing.'
'Have at thee, fiend!'
'Commander, take these heroes and hold the line for as long as you are able.'
'Blast! He keeps pushing us back!'
'Durin's Folk, draw nigh and hear me.'
'Fiends of fire and darkness! You will fall before us!'
'It matters not what form the terror takes! Charge!'
'Good, you have arrived. King Náin is ready to begin. Come with me.'
'Beasts of the deep. They flee before the horde.'
'This is it, dwarves! All we must do is survive! For Durin! For Náin!'
'Soldiers of Durin's Folk! Hear me!'
'Sound the horn and let it begin! Baruk Khazâd!'
'King Náin! No!'
'Father! Run!'
'Father, forgive my insolence, but this is folly! You heard the Elves.'
'The thought of walking for miles under the open sky makes me anxious.'
'On the King's order, the soldiers below will force the nameless creatures to the other end of the Second Hall.'
'Hold the line! Ware the cloud!'
'Ah! You are right, Commander. Nafni, Sverri, come with me. We must save our people!'
'Perhaps one of our old holdings in the Grey Mountains. And if not there, someplace new....'
'Father... I will obey your final command.'

In the year 1981 of the Third Age, the Longbeards made their final stand against the Balrog known as 'Durin's Bane'. The brave dwarves that defied the terror on that day would be the saviors of their people, but the fate of their kingdom was certain.
'Come taste my axe, rokhiz!'
'Many trials await us in the years ahead, but I swear this to all of you: the Longbeards will find a new home and thrive once more.'
'Lead them with honour, my son.'
'And we will avenge him, and retake our kingdom! For the honour of my father, and of every Durin before!'
'The nameless horde has come!'
'Fall back!'
'Let it meet the might of Durin's Folk on OUR terms.'
'Nay, if we could not hold Khazad-dûm, neither can we break the Orcs’ grip on that place.'
'By Durin's Beard!'
'Take position, soldiers. May the First Crafter smile upon us.'
'Ah. He did not survive. Later we will sing of his valour. Remember too those who died with him, and...'
